greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A001222(A283983(n)).
comment: a(n) = Sum_{c} floor(c/2), where c ranges over each coefficient of terms c * x^k in the Stern polynomial B(n,x), thus sum of the halved terms (for odd terms floored down) on row n of table A125184.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: Other identities and observations. For all n >= 0:
program: A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ From _Michel Marcus_
A000188(n) = core(n, 1)[2]; \\ This function from _Michel Marcus_, Feb 27 2013
xref: Cf. A023758 (gives the positions of zeros).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 25 2017
